data.title: Anything Can Happen (1952)
data.meta_description: A quirky relationship unfolds between an immigrant and an all-American folk music fan.
data.text:
Jose Ferrer comes to America from the country of Georgia and along with a Turkish fellow he meets on the ride over here attempts to adjust to life in America in the 50s and thru a silly turn of events ends up meeting and falling in love with a court sternographer played by Kim Hunter who is a big collector of world folk music and immediately asks Ferrer if he can sing, and he's like no but I can sing you a couple songs I knew growing up from the village I lived in.

The movie kinda abandons the singing angle after Hunter has to go out west to California to care for a sick aunt that she's close to.…

George Seaton’s romantic comedy in which a Soviet immigrant (Jose Ferrer) touches down in New York, locates a wife (Kim Hunter) and becomes the holder of a California orange grove.

Adapted from the biographical novel of the same name by Helen and George Papashvily, which was published seven years earlier, the story concerns Giorgi, a man of character, who émigrés from Georgia, U.S.S.R. to the United States. He and other Georgian settlers there help one another while finding it hard to get a job and become American citizens. Giorgi falls for a handsome journalist interested in his case.

Jose Ferrer gives a good performance in his role as Giorgi, the immigrant who lands in the United States and has to…
